results.title: Sweetie
results.creator_credit: Jane Campion, John Maynard and Arenafilm
results.brief_description: Kay is frightened of the future and the present, of life and death of loneliness and love. She’s frightened of trees that wither and die, frightened of shadow and light, frightened of giving herself up to her dreams and memories. When a clairvoyant describes, minutely, the man of her life, Kay abruptly interrupts the constant stream of monogamous relationships which had been her pattern, to set up home with Louis, the ex-boyfriend of a colleague. After a year of apparent happiness, her fears are rekindled, she turns away from Louis and withdraws inexorably into herself. that’s when her sister, Sweetie, appears. Sweetie is impulsive and untidy, a fat adolescent who, her father believes, is the artist of the family. She loses no time in turning Kay’s ordered world upside down with her capricious demands, voracious sensuality, enormous appetite and terrifying rages. Cast: Genevieve Lemon, Karen Colston, Tom Lycos.

results.title: Samson and Sally [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: This fully animated film is a warm, funny and gripping adventure about two young whales, Samson and Sally. Sally is accepted into Samson’s herd after her mother gets killed by whalers. The two young whales become great friends and we follow their exciting journeys in the magic world of the ocean. Their lives are not without danger as they encounter whalers and the dumping of radioactive waste.

results.title: As you like it
results.creator_credit: Basil Coleman, Cedric Messina, Time-Life Films and BBC
results.brief_description: Orlando is forced to flee to the forest to escape the evil plots of his jealous brother, Oliver. Rosalind incurs her uncle’s wrath and also flees to the forest, accompanied by Celia and Touchstone the clown. Disguised as a youth known as Ganymede, Rosalind meets Orlando who confides his love for Rosalind to Ganymede (Rosalind). Oliver arrives in the forest and is saved from certain death by Orlando and the two brothers are reconciled. Oliver woos Celia, Touchstone woos the dullwitted Audrey, Silvius (a shepherd) woos Phoebe and Phoebe woos the disguised Rosalind who finally reveals her identity to Orlando. The four pairs of lovers are united in the feast of Hymen.

results.title: Grace Kelly - the American Princess
results.brief_description: Grace Kelly became the most sought after actress of her time and an Academy Award winner at 24. Having mastered her craft and at the height of her career, she stunned the world by choosing to leave Hollywood and become Her Serene Highness, Princess Grace of Monaco. Her remarkable story is told through film clips, home movies and interviews with Jimmy Stewart, Alec Guinness, Stanley Kramer, Louis Jourdan and others. Rated: PG

results.title: Gregory Peck - His Own Man
results.brief_description: In Hollywood where many actors scramble for success - and are desperate to hold onto it - Gregory peck has taken chances. While he has become one of Hollywood’s most illustrious stars (49 movies in 39 years) Peck has always remained his own man. Rated: PG

results.title: The Phantom of the opera (1925)
results.creator_credit: Rupert Julian, Carl Laemmle and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The cinema classic features the legendary Lon Chaney in one of his finest performances. The famed unmasking sequence is still powerful after all these years, and the final scene of the Phantom restraining the mobs of Paris to protect his true love will linger in the memory. Colour-tinted version with music accompaniment provided by the City of Prague Philharmonic.

results.title: Going Down
results.brief_description: A searing vision of a Sydney rarely seen by tourists but one that is just below the surface. A cult hit in the past, this film has been described by Philip Adams as one of the ten best made in this country. It is the story of four young women on the town the night before one of them is travelling to New York. Their adolescence, their group, their future is breaking up. Starring Tracy Mann and David Argue.

results.title: The Man from Snowy River
results.brief_description: The Man From Snowy River, based on the classic Australian poem by Banjo Patterson, tells the story of an 18 year old boy who proves himself a man during an unforgettable chase on horseback down the rugged Snowy Mountains and becomes a legend. The most magnificent footage of horses ever filmed.

constellations_other.name: The ‘Australian' alps
constellations_other.description: These feature films and documentaries show how stories have been told to lay claim - and reclaim - the land and our national identity.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.title: Man of Flowers
results.brief_description: Norman Kaye won the AFI’s best actor award for this stunning portrayal of Charles Bremer, a strange and sensitive man, whose sensual appreciation of all things beautiful led to his bizarre and erotic relationship with a young bi-sexual named Lisa. “Man of Flowers” is both erotic and richly amusing with a tragic after glow.

results.title: Ginger Meggs
results.brief_description: The famous characters of Australia’s most loved comic strip are brought to life in this full-length movie. Tracing the mischievous antics of Ginger Meggs, his friends and foes, the film is a series of vividly visual misadventures as “Meggsie” and his gang create havoc and uproar through their larrikin ways of dodging the law and, more often than not, plunging headfirst into trouble.
